html: Waiting for Jehovah amid troubled times distinguishes his elect from the remainder of his people: “I will wait for Jehovah, who hides his face from the house of Jacob, and expect him” (Isaiah 8:17 ). Although Jehovah’s judgments may appear to last forever, causing many of his people to grow weary (Isaiah 43:22; 49:14 ), all is worth the outcome (Isaiah 25:9; 64:4 ). Jehovah keeps his part of the terms of his covenant by showing favor or compassion toward those who endure to the end (Isaiah 30:18; 49:13 ). He becomes their arm of salvation when he intervenes wondrously to deliver them (Isaiah 51:5; 63:5 ).
